messages.message:
@Matt that is actually working as intended :slightly_smiling_face: so here is the context: To make sure that we don’t duplicate all the confidence / provenance tracking information for the IBOCR / IBDOC produced by refiner, we use a field called `original_ibocr` which points to the IBOCR produced as a result of the process_file step.

Now, since you have moved the folder, but haven’t run the Flow, the ibocr still contains references to the old location from where it was copied.
hmmm so this just started happening to a ton of my links, this seems probalamatic if people are to just copy things around to see results
Is a possible workaround running the refiner/flow/metaflow again?
@will yes, that is the possible workaround
That seems to be the solution but does not solve for if I were to copy results to a different repo
that should regenerate the missing info
